forumNotes.content:

> 0xc000000e  
> \\boot\\BCD\\  
> an error occured while attempting to read boot configuration data.  
>
> WHY ? grub4dos,  
> I make it with rmprepusb, even on pendrive LEXAR USB RETRAX with FLIPPED RMB to seen as hardrive -\> the same, why how to fix it ?

If it boots on some computers but not others then it must be the 2/10 computers (or rather their BIOSes).  
The symptom is usually because the BIOS is trying to boot the USB pen as a floppy disk. Look in the BIOS Setup menu for a 'Fixed Disk' or 'Hard Disk' setting for USB booting.  
Use the 2PTN switch in RMPrepUSB (new version out today v2.0.730).  

Try making the same USB pen as a FreeDOS bootable pen using FreeDos files which come with RMPrepUSB - does it boot as A: or C: ???  

What size is the USB pen? Try 2GB+.   
S
